result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed: Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Angel A Mercado Arias in court.  Attorney Claire Longdin in court for Angel A Mercado Arias.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Off the record. Case scheduled for plea/sentencing hearing. Defense requests an adjourned date. State has no objection. Case adjourned, Branch 40.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Received and filed: Attorney Claire Longdin

Adjustment Number: 22A 061608,
Payable Number: 1017708,
Receipt Number: 22RP027143,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Angel A Mercado Arias in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in Court for a scheduling conference.  Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.  Court set the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 06-09-2022

Defendant Angel A Mercado Arias in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont, appear by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report  Actual Date Bond Posted with *SHERIFFS 5/12/2022
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for supervision level 3.   No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Angel A Mercado Arias in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Grace M. Gall appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for initial appearance.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
